Key Match Events: Vincent Aboubakar ignited the home crowd with an early penalty kick conversion, barely eight minutes after kickoff
Michael Olunga scored the solitary goal for Kenya in the 41st minute
Brian Mbeumo stretched Cameroon's lead two minutes later
Christian Bassogog hammered the final nail into Kenya's casket with a splendid goal in the 55th minute
Post-Match Reflections: The outcome extended Cameroon's dominance over Kenya, stretching their wins to five in the nine encounters involving the teams since 1972 when they met for the first time
Kenya has not won a single match against the West African nation
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cameroon dominated possession with 61 per cent compared to Kenya's 39 per cent
The teams will flex their muscles in the second-leg fixture on Monday
Others: Kenya's hopes of earning a spot in the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations were severely damaged following a horrendous outing in Doula, Cameroon on Friday

Kenya now drops to third after matchday 3 and they must now try to get at least a point in the return leg against Cameroon on Monday in Uganda to avoid being pushed out of qualification positions ahead of the final matchday in November
